title: Strictly's Neil Jones hits back at Craig Revel Horwood over Alex Scott 'mistake'
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Neil Jones has rubbished Craig Revel Horwood’s claims that Alex Scott made a mistake during last week’s episode of Strictly Come Dancing.

The couple wowed us all with their impressive Tango to Go Your Own Way by Fleetwood Mac during last Saturday’s show, but found themselves at the bottom of the leaderboard after being given a measly four points by Craig.

Strictly’s resident Mr. Nasty criticised Alex particularly for going wrong during the dance, something Neil was having none of when he appeared on It Takes Two on Thursday evening.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’ve actually watched back the video over and over again, you didn’t go wrong,’ he reassured Alex.

‘Even Artem [Chigvintsev] said it the other day, you didn’t go wrong.’

Echoing Neil’s point, Alex admitted: ‘I was quite surprised when they said that because that was the best one yet and I loved the week training, the Tango.

Neil leaped to Alex’s defense (Picture: BBC)

‘When he said I went wrong, I was like, “did I?”’

‘No, she didn’t go wrong,’ Neil concluded.

Interesting!

Despite landing at the bottom of the leaderboard with just 23 points, Alex and Neil found themselves avoiding the dance off and living to dance another week.

However, many fans criticised the judges marking that week, saying that the couple did not deserve a four from Craig in the same week that he gave David James a six and Mike a seven.

But it was Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell’s placing near the bottom of the leaderboard that was the cause of the most audience outrage, after the couple became the third pairing to leave the competition in a shock elimination.

Fans of the couple even threatened to boycott the show following the judge’s decision, with fellow dancer AJ Pritchard having to publicly beg viewers to stop sending head judge Shirley Ballas death threats over the decision.

Advertisement

Strictly Come Dancing returns Saturday 19 October at 6.40pm on BBC One.

description: Neil Jones has rubbished Craig Revel Horwood’s claims that Alex Scott went wrong during last week’s episode of Strictly Come Dancing.
